stackup.name: Stackup
stackup.description: The stackup of the board: Free stackup (supplier to choose), specified in a separate file or specified in this file. Can also include the stackup itself.

tags.description: The stack up of this board

values.description: The manufacturer can choose the stackup that matches the rest of the requirements
A file is supplied with the package that will contain the actual stackup.
The actual stackup is under the stackup->specified tag

tags.description: The URI of the file that specifies the stackup. Either as a path witin a project compressed file (ZIP) or as a link

The container where the elements describing the stackup should be placed. All elements under object must contain the "layer_order" tags to set the order of the layer. They should also contain the "layer_name" tag to set the descriptive name of the layer

rigid_conductive_layer.name: Rigid Conductive layer
rigid_conductive_layer.description: The layers of rigid conductive material (usually copper)

tags.description: The number of conductive layers.
The minimum nominal width of conductors on internal/unplated layers (minimum track).
The minimum nominal width of conductors on external/plated layers (minimum track). If only only one minimum track is present, is should be here.
The minimum gap between two conductors on the internal layers.
The minimum gap between two conductors on the external layers. If only one minimum gap is present, is should be here.
Finished base copper thickness following IPC Class on the up to two external layers in micrometer.
Finished base copper thickness following IPC Class on the internal layers in micrometer.
The roughness of the copper foil.
The average copper coverage of the board. UoM is percentage

flexible_conductive_layer.name: Flexible Conductive layer
flexible_conductive_layer.description: The layers of flexible conductive material (usually copper)

tags.description: The number of conductive layers.
The minimum nominal width of conductors on internal/unplated layers (minimum track).
The minimum nominal width of conductors on external/plated layers (minimum track). If only only one minimum track is present, is should be here.
The minimum gap between two conductors on the internal layers.
The minimum gap between two conductors on the external layers. If only one minimum gap is present, is should be here.
Finished base copper thickness following IPC Class on the up to two external layers in micrometer.
Finished base copper thickness following IPC Class on the internal layers in micrometer.
The roughness of the copper foil.
The The type of the copper foil
The average copper coverage of the board. UoM is percentage

final_finish.aliases: Surfacefinish, Surface finish, Coating, finalfinish, Solderable finish, Solderable coating
final_finish.name: Final Finish
final_finish.description: A list of final finishes, can be more than one. E.g. selective finish ENIG and OSP.

tags.description: The material/method/surface to be used in the finish.

values.description: ASTM-B-488 Gold for edge printed board connectors and areas not to be soldered
J-STD-003 Gold Electroplate on areas to be soldered
ASTM-B-488 Gold Electroplate for areas to be wire bonded (ultrasonic)
ASTM-B-488 Gold Electroplate for areas to be wire bonded (thermosonic)
J-STD-003_J-STD-006 Solder Coating over Bare Copper (HASL)
J-STD-003_J-STD-006 Lead-Free Solder Coating over Bare Copper (Lead-Free HASL, Lead free HASL)
No final finish should be used

tags.description: The area that the finish will cover, in square decimeter.
The minimum thickness of the finish in micrometer.
The maximum thickness of the finish in micrometer.
The minimum thickness of the gold finish in micrometer.
The maximim thickness of the gold finish in micrometer.
The minimum thickness of silver the finish in micrometer.
The maximum thickness of silver the finish in micrometer.
The minimum thickness of the paladium finish in micrometer.
The maximim thickness of the paladium finish in micrometer.
The minimum thickness of the tin finish in micrometer.
The maximum thickness of the tin finish in micrometer.
The minimum thickness of the nickel finish in micrometer.
The maximum thickness of the nickel finish in micrometer.

dielectric.name: Dielectric
dielectric.description: A list of one of more materials used as dielectric. Every material listed here must have be listed in the materials section with the name of the material as the key.

tags.description: The name of a material that appears in the materials section

soldermask.aliases: solder mask, sm, solder resist, green mask
soldermask.name: Soldermask
soldermask.description: A list of final soldermasks, can be more than one

tags.description: This describes the color based on the name of the color; green, black, blue, red, white, yellow. If a specific color needs to be defined, this can be done custom -> colors section.
The finish of the soldermask.
The minimum thickness of the soldermask.
The maximum thickness of the soldermask.
The name of a material that appears in the materials section
Indicates soldermask presence/capability at top
Indicates soldermask presence/capability at bottom
The manufacturer is allowed to do touchups on the soldermask if true

legend.name: Legend
legend.description: The legend to be used on the board

tags.description: This describes the color based on the name of the color; white, yellow. If a specific color needs to be defined, this can be done custom -> colors section.
Indicates legend presence/capability at top
Indicates legend presence/capability at bottom
The size of the stiffener should be specified in drawing
Indicating if the stiffener is on top or bottom of the flexible layer.

values.description: The stiffener is on top of the flexible layer(s)
The stiffener is below the flexible layer(s)

tags.description: The thickness of the stiffener
The name of a material that appears in the materials section
The total thickness of the coverlay
Indicates coverlay presence/capability at top
Indicates coverlay presence/capability at bottom
The name of a material that appears in the materials -> soldermask section
Indicates peelable mask presence/capability at top
Indicates peelable mask presence/capability at bottom
If alternative to DuPont Kapton HN general-purpose film can be used
Indicates peelable mask presence/capability at top
Indicates peelable mask presence/capability at bottom
Indicates Conductive Carbon Print presence/capability at top
Indicates Conductive Carbon Print presence/capability at bottom
Indicates silver print presence/capability at top
Indicates silver print presence/capability at bottom

inner_packaging.name: Inner Packaging
inner_packaging.description: This describes how boards are packed together to be shipped. Part of IPC 1601 (4.2.2)

tags.description: The material of the bag to be used
True to include a Humidity Indicator Card (HIC), False to not
True to indicate that packaging for ESD-sensitive required.
True to indicate that a desiccant material is required.
True to indicate that vacuum is needed for shrinkage - no heat rap or shrink rap allowed.

via_protection.name: Via Protection
via_protection.description: The via/hole protection according to IPC 4761

tags.description: A via with a dry film mask material applied bridging over the via wherein no additional materials are in the hole.
A Type I via with a secondary covering of mask material applied over the tented via.
A via with material applied allowing partial penetration into the via. The plug material may be applied from one or both sides.
A Type III via with a secondary covering of material applied over the via. The plug material may be applied from one or both sides.
A Type III via with a secondary covering of material applied over the via. The plug material may be applied from one or both sides.
A via with material applied into the via targeting a full penetration and encapsulation of the hole.
A Type V via with a secondary covering of material (liquid or dry film soldermask) applied over the via. The plug material may be applied from one or both sides.
A Type V via with a secondary covering of material (liquid or dry film soldermask) applied over the via. The plug material may be applied from one or both sides.
A Type V via with a secondary metallized coating covering the via. The metallization is on both sides.

board.name: Board
board.description: The physical description of the board

tags.description: The size of the board in the x-asis, measured in millimeters
The size of the board in the y-asis, measured in millimeters
The thickness of the board measured in millimeters
The weight of the board measured in grams

array.name: Array
array.description: The physical description of the array of boards, used in assembly

tags.description: The size of the array in the x-asis, measured in millimeters
The size of the array in the y-asis, measured in millimeters
Number of boards in the panel in the x-direction.
Number of boards in the panel in the y-direction.
Number total number of boards in the panel. This is not the preferred method of stating the number, "boards_x" and "boards_y" should be used.
The size of the left side boarder between the edge and the board measured in millimeters. When used in a Profile or Capability, it must specify minimum needed boarder
The size of the right side boarder between the edge and the board measured in millimeters. When used in a Profile or Capability, it must specify minimum needed boarder
The size of the top side boarder between the edge and the board measured in millimeters. When used in a Profile or Capability, it must specify minimum needed boarder
The size of the bottom side boarder between the edge and the board measured in millimeters. When used in a Profile or Capability, it must specify minimum needed boarder
The size of the space between the boards in the x-direction measured in millimeters. When used in a Profile or Capability, it must specify the minimum needed space
The size of the space between the boards in the y-direction measured in millimeters. When used in a Profile or Capability, it must specify the minimum needed space
The number of fiducials on the array.
The size of the fiducials measured in millimeters. If used in a Profile, it is the minimum needed size
The shape of the fiducials.
The method of creation of the breakaways on the array
Indicates if there should be "mouse bites" to allow easy break away of the boards
The number of tooling holes on the array.
The size of the tooling holes measured in millimeters. If used in a Profile, it is the minimum needed size.
Manufacturer can deliver arrays with defect boards as long as these are clearly marked as defect (X'ed out).
The maximum number of defective and clearly marked as such boards that are allowed on on panel, stated in percentage
The maximum number of defective and clearly marked as such boards that are allowed on on panel, stated in percentage
The weight of the array measured in grams
Edge bevelling present.
Depth Routing from the top present
Depth Routing from the bottom present.
Counterboring from the top present.
Counterboring from the bottom present.
Countersink from the top present.
Countersink from the bottom present.
Punching process required.
Plated Edges process required.
Plated Slots process required.
Plated Castellated Holes process required.
Coin Attachment process required.
Selective plated pads present.
The layers included in the connectors, counter from 1 (top layer).

hard_gold_edge_connectors.name: Hard Gold Edge Connectors
hard_gold_edge_connectors.description: Edge connectors made with hard gold

tags.description: Hard gold edge connectors present.
The thickness of the connectors

values.description: To be specified in the thicknes_other tag

tags.description: Thickness if it is not "0.76" or "1.27".
Area covered by the edge connectors in square desimeter.
The layers included in the connectors, counter from 1 (top layer).
Possible values are "YY" for year, "WW" for week "-" and "LOT" (alias "BATCH"). E.g. "YYWW-LOT" or "LOT-YYWW". If no marking, set "NONE".
Placement of the markings.
Manufacturer identification present.
Possible values are the ones listed in the subelement "standards" but typical will be "ul" and "rohs"
Serial number should be added in the markings.
Format of the serial number expressed as a "regular expression" but needs to have x amount of digits in it.
The number to start the serial number from. Will have to replace the digits from the "serial_number_format" above.
The increase in number from "serial_number_start" with each product.

standards.name: Standards and Requirements
standards.description: If the format is boolean and nothing is stated other than the name of the standard in the Decription column, it should be understood as follows: Are to be met (if Specification), required (in Profile) or possible (in Capability)

tags.description: Indicating if UL is required for the board. Can not be used as a capability, as this will be indicated on each material.
Indicating if Canadian UL is required for the board. Can not be used as a capability, as this will be indicated on each material.
RoHS.
UL 94 - Standard for Safety of Flammability of Plastic Materials for Parts in Devices and Appliances testing

values.description: HB - Slow burning on a horizontal specimen; burning rate < 76 mm/min for thickness < 3 mm or burning stops before 100 mm
V-0 - Burning stops within 30 seconds on a vertical specimen; drips of flaming particles are allowed.
V-1 - Burning stops within 30 seconds on a vertical specimen; drips of particles allowed as long as they are not inflamed.
V-2 - Burning stops within 30 seconds on a vertical specimen; drips of flaming particles are allowed.
5VB - Burning stops within 60 seconds on a vertical specimen; no drips allowed; plaque specimens may develop a hole.
5VA - Burning stops within 60 seconds on a vertical specimen; no drips allowed; plaque specimens may not develop a hole.

tags.description: European Space Agency Use.
US ITAR.
US DFARS.
MIL-PRF-55110.
MIL-PRF-5884.
MIL-PRF-31032.
NADCAP.
Railway Europe EN45545-2:2013.
Railway France NF F 16-101.
Railway Italy UNI CEI 11170-3.
Railway USA NFPA 130.
According to Table 4-2 /4-3.

values.description: As Agreed Between User and Supplier

tags.description: Used either if ipc_6010_class is set to 2 and you want to add copper plating thickness demands from class 3, or the other way round - class 3 is set but you can accept demands from class 2.
Used either if ipc_6010_class is set to 2 and you want to add annular ring demands from class 3, or the other way round - class 3 is set but you can accept demands from class 2.
Used either if ipc_6010_class is set to 2 and you want to add conductor spacing demands from class 3, or the other way round - class 3 is set but you can accept demands from class 2.
Used either if ipc_6010_class is set to 2 and you want to add conductor width demands from class 3, or the other way round - class 3 is set but you can accept demands from class 2.
Requirements according to IPC 6012 class.
Requirements according to IPC 6013 for flexible or rigid-flex boards.
IPC-6018 Microwave End Product Board Inspection and Test.
100% Netlist testing according to IPC-D-356, ODB++ or IPC2581.
Allow Netlist to be generated from Gerber or other file format if needed.
HiPot Test (Dielectric Withstanding Voltage Test).
Use 4 wired test
Use IST testing.

country_of_origin.name: Country of Origin
country_of_origin.description: Country of Origin is the country where the Printed Circuit Board is manufactured.

tags.description: A three letter string representation of the Country of origin according too ISO 3166-1.
A two letter string representation of the Country of origin according too ISO 3166-1.
Indicates if the COO is a NATO member state
Indicates if the COO is a European Union member state.

conflict_resolution.name: Conflict resolution
conflict_resolution.description: If several sources of data is present, this hierarchy is to set how to solve conflicts. Please specify a number to indicate priority and avoid setting the same number twice.

tags.description: Information provided on order level
Information provided from the OEM in a PDF or other document format
Information provided from the assembly facility in a PDF or other document format
Information in a drawing (if present)
Information in an IPC-2581 file
Information in a ODB++ file.
Information in a Gerber format file

holes.name: Holes
holes.description: One for each holes process, or at least one that sums up the minimum requirements

tags.description: The number of holes total or in this process.
The type of holes.
True if the holes are plated.
The size of the hole in micrometers. Can be considered the minimum hole size if only one holes element present in the list or as a capability.
If false, size indicates the hole diameter, if true the size indicates the tool diameter
The layer where the hole starts, counted from the top, where top layer is 1.
The layer where the hole stops, counted from the top, where top layer is 1.
The depth of the hole in micrometer.
Can be either "routing" or "drilling", where drilling is default
The minimum designed annular ring in micrometers.
Press Fit holes.
Copper filled holes.
Staggered holes.
Stacked holes.
ALIVH holes.

allowed_modifications.name: Allowed Modifications
allowed_modifications.description: Changes/fabrication decisions that are allowed to make to the files provided.

tags.description: Non Functioning Pad removal.
Adding copper balancing pattern
Adding copper balancing pattern on array/panel frame.
Adding Tear Drops.

additional_requirements.name: Additional Requirements
additional_requirements.description: This section is for all requirements that still has not been adapted to the standard or needs to be stated as a comment. It allows you to specify custom elements that should be considered as part of the specification. You specify the value here and then need to create a separate element for it in the custom -> additional section. Multiple elements allowed - to be added as a list.

tags.description: Must have a similar element in the custom -> additional

colors.name: any_name
colors.description: Colors can be defined by hex, rgb, cmyk or name. Name of the color present here can be references in the other elements

tags.description: name of the color
How the color is declared

If type is hex, the value needs to be a "#" + 6 hexadecimals (e.g. "#FFFFFF"). for "rgb" the format is "rgb(0, 255, 255)", for "cmyk" the format is "cmyk(100%, 0%, 0%, 0%)". The name is just a string.

soldermasks.name: Soldermasks
soldermasks.description: Materials used as soldermask. Must be placed within a "printed_circuits_fabrication_data" element that also contains a version

tags.description: The name of the Soldermask. Use the official name or some name as close to it as possible
The name of the manufacturer
Soldermask to meet IPC SM 840 Class.
The link to some url that gives more information or a reference to the product.

dielectrics.name: Dielectrics
dielectrics.description: Materials used as dielectrics/laminates. Must be placed within a "printed_circuits_fabrication_data" element that also contains a version

tags.description: The name of the Laminate. Use the official name or some name as close to it as possible.
The name of the manufacturer
The reference sheet number of the IPC 4101 Standard.
The reference sheet number of the IPC 4103 Standard.
The reference sheet number of the IPC 4204 Standard.
The minimum Glass Transition Temperature (Tg) required.
The Glass Transition Temperature (Tg) range starts at.
The Glass Transition Temperature (Tg) range ands at.
The minimum required temperature at which a base laminate material experiences an established percentage of weight loss using Thermograv imetric Analysis (TGA).
The Td range starts at.
The Td range stops at.
Indicates the material is material free or is required to be
Railway Europe EN45545-2:2013 compatible
Railway France NF F 16-101 compatible
Railway Italy UNI CEI 11170-3 compatible.
Railway USA NFPA 130 compatible.
UL compatible.
The link to some url that gives more information or a reference to the product.
Equivalent material to the one specified is OK to use as a replacement if true.

stiffener.name: Stiffener
stiffener.description: The materials to be used as stiffener. Must be placed within a "printed_circuits_fabrication_data" element that also contains a version

tags.description: The name of the Soldermask. Use the official name or some name as close to it as possible
The name of the manufacturer
The link to some url that gives more information or a reference to the product.

additional.name: any_name
additional.description: Must have a similar element in specification -> additional_requirements

tags.description: The description of the additional requirement or comment
